result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devon Michael Garza

records.addlTxt:
8:38 AM Defendant Devon Michael Garza appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Devon Michael Garza.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court notes livestreaming for victim. Attorney Nelsen received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty plea. Attorney Nelsen defers to State. State notes other cases set for sentencing and jury trial. State waiting for PSI to be completed. Attorney Nelsen in agreement.
Status conference scheduled for January 20, 2023 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Exhibit 1 from preliminary hearing - certified bond sheet from 20CF406

8:32 AM Defendant Devon Michael Garza in court, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Devon Michael Garza.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. 

State calls Joel Markon, sworn and testifies.
Detective with Superior Police Department.
Investigation in regards to Devin Garza. Knows there are three pending cases in Douglas County and victim 1 in each case is the same person.
Reviewed jail phone call/text records; a number of calls/texts to the phone number identified as victim 1s.  Witness called that phone number and spoke/confirmed with victim 1.
Witness identifies defendant
Attorney Nelsen has no response
Record reflects identification of the defendant

Attorney Nelsen has no cross examination

Court questions witness
Victim 1 was at home when receiving messages in Douglas County Wisconsin

Exhibit 1-certified copy of bail sheet 20cf406 M-O-R
State requests the Court take judicial notice of 20CF406 is still open and 22CF163 which is still opening pending a jury trial.

State final comments
Defense final comments

Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed, binds over for arraignment. Court takes judicial notice of pending felony cases noted by the State.
Court reminds of bail/conditions.
Arraignment scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:15 AM Defendant Devon Michael Garza in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant- Qualifies for public defender, doesn't want to go forward
Court- had hearing yesterday, defendant wanted to go forward
State- was informed yesterday he wanted to proceed. Ready to go forward
Court- Was told yesterday multiple times he wanted to go forward today
Defendant waives time limits
Court- will reset prelim, State may request extra fines or fees from having witness here today.
Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:58 PM Defendant Devon Michael Garza appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant indicates that his family has contacted the public defenders office. They are looking to assign counsel. Attorney Hoffman is present via video. Defendant indicates that family members called the public defender's office. The Superior public defender's office (Hoffman) indicates that they do not have an application on file yet. Court questions why the defendant has not yet made a phone call. Defendant indicates that he has limited access to phone and texting devices. Defendant wishes to proceed with the preliminary hearing without counsel. Court informs defendant of right to waive time limits to allow time to obtain counsel. Defendant verifies that he would like to proceed to preliminary hearing without counsel.
No contact with Victim 1. No use of jail texter.

2:13 PM Defendant Devon Michael Garza appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Allison Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case. Address verified. Court recites charges against defendant and possible penalties. Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney. Defendant pleads not guilty. Court accepts plea.
State requests $5000 cash, conditions of no contact with Victim 1 and no use of jail texter. 
Defendant has no response.
Court orders $5,000 cash, with conditions of no contact with Victim 1 and no use of jail texter.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
ID Key, Motion, and Order to Seal
